newsitem.title: JAPAN: Int'l cooperation unlikely to lower dlr - Japan PM.
newsitem.headline: Int'l cooperation unlikely to lower dlr - Japan PM.

text.p: The dollar is unlikely to be lowered through international cooperation, Japanese Prime Minster Ryutaro Hashimoto told a parliamentary committee on Monday.
Hashimoto said the recent fall of the yen was due to a singular strengthening of the dollar, adding that the greenback had risen against both the mark and the Swiss franc as well.
"So, is it possible to lower the value of the dollar through international cooperation? I don't think that's the feeling at the moment," Hashimoto said.
He also said an excessive strengthening of the dollar was undesirable, and that Japan did not welcome excessive movements in foreign exchange rates.
